title: 2 charged in Brockton killing after months as fugitives, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Micheal Thompson, 35, and Dayana Slade, 25, were arrested in Maine for the fatal shooting of Mike Jonas in Brockton.
Thompson faces first degree murder charges and is held without bail; Slade is charged as an accessory and held on $250,000 bail.
Jonas was fatally shot and stabbed following an altercation at Finnegan Park in Brockton on September 23, 2025.

title: Red Sox reportedly tried to trade for standout shortstop this offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox attempted to trade for Angels' shortstop Zach Neto this offseason but couldn't meet trade demands.
Los Angeles Angels' Zach Neto, known for his defensive skills and power, remains under team control until 2029.
Red Sox acquired Caleb Durbin from Brewers, likely filling third base alongside Trevor Story and Marcelo Mayer.

title: Former driving school owner gets 1 day in jail for RMV bribery scheme
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Carlos Cardosa, former Brockton driving school owner, sentenced to one day in jail for RMV bribery scheme.
Cardosa paid $20,000 in bribes to an RMV employee for issuing licenses without road tests from 2019 to 2021.
Cardosa fined $5,500 and will serve six months home incarceration due to extraordinary health issues.

title: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B may have broken up following Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B have unfollowed each other on Instagram after the Patriots' Super Bowl LX loss to the Seahawks.
The pair welcomed a baby boy together in November 2025, marking Cardi B's fourth child and Diggs' third.
Diggs faces February 13 arraignment for felony strangulation and misdemeanor assault charges from an alleged December incident.

title: An emotional Alex Cora explains why Bad Bunnyâ€™s Super Bowl performance meant so much to him
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora expressed pride in Bad Bunny's all-Spanish Super Bowl Halftime Show performance.
Cora appreciated Bad Bunny's representation of Puerto Rican culture, highlighting details like the coconut stand and traditional boxing.
Despite criticism, NFL commissioner Roger Goodell praised Bad Bunny as a unifying performer for his impactful Super Bowl show.

title: Watch: Providence releases body cam footage of Brown University shooting response
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Providence released 20 minutes of body cam footage from police response to Brown University shooting that killed two in December.
The footage shows Lt. Patrick Potter coordinating response efforts, including clearing areas and escorting medical teams to victims.
The suspect, Claudio Manuel Neves Valente, killed three people in total across multiple locations before dying from a self-inflicted gunshot.

title: Former Patriots lineman Keion White undergoes surgery after being shot in ankle in San Francisco
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Keion White, a San Francisco 49ers lineman, was shot in the ankle and underwent surgery in San Francisco.
The shooting incident occurred hours after the Super Bowl at Levi's Stadium, involving a verbal altercation between groups.
San Francisco police have not made any arrests and are investigating the incident, which involved an unknown suspect.

title: Jayson Tatum to practice with Maine Celtics as he nears potential return
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum practices with the Maine Celtics as part of his rehabilitation from an Achilles injury.
Tatum has been participating in controlled 5-on-5 scrimmages and posted videos of his progress.
The Celtics, tied for second in the Eastern Conference, await Tatum's full recovery and return.

title: Hikers rescued in Vermont amid sub-zero temperatures
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Two Canadian hikers rescued Saturday near the summit of Camel's Hump in Duxbury, Vermont, amid sub-zero temperatures.
Rescue teams reached the 21-year-old man and 19-year-old woman suffering hypothermia at 11:20 p.m., after a 911 call.
The male hiker walked down after warming; the female was stretchered down and hospitalized, both expected to fully recover.

title: 6 offseason priorities for Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots need to address offensive line issues after Drake Maye was sacked six times in Super Bowl LX.
New England plans to bolster their roster through the 2026 NFL Draft, targeting offensive and defensive positions.
Cornerback Christian Gonzalez is expected to receive a new contract following his standout performance in the postseason.
